conclusion: Determine the acceleration of cargo A and the time it takes to travel from the left end to the right end.
Figure C shows a conveyor with cargo at the same height as the conveyor, moving clockwise.
Cargo is released from rest at the left end of the conveyor.
The length of the conveyor is L1 = 6 m, and the conveyor moves at a speed of v0 = 2 m/s.
The kinetic friction coefficient between cargo A and the conveyor is μ1 = 0.2.
Figure C shows the conveyor moving in a horizontal direction with cargo placed on it.
Identify the forces acting on cargo A: gravitational force mg downward, normal force N upward, and kinetic friction force fk opposite to motion.
Calculate the kinetic friction force: fk = μ1 N, and since N = mg, fk = μ1 mg.
Determine the net force and acceleration: net force is fk, using F = ma, fk = ma, thus μ1 mg = ma.
Solve for acceleration a: a = μ1 g.
Substitute the given values: μ1 = 0.2, g = 10 m/s², therefore a = 0.2 × 10 = 2 m/s².
Determine the distance traveled: length of the conveyor L1 = 6 m.
Use the kinematic equation: s = ut + 0.5at², with u = 0, s = L1, and a = 2 m/s².
Substitute the known values: 6 = 0 × t + 0.5 × 2 × t², simplifying to 6 = t².
Solve for time t: t² = 6, thus t = √6 ≈ 2.45 s.
The acceleration of cargo A when it is just placed on the conveyor is 2 m/s².
The time it takes to travel from the left end to the right end is approximately 2.45 s.
